description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4sab7","text":"This is a spin column based environmental DNA extraction protocol that has been validated with mineral soil and forest floor samples. The protocol starts with disruption and lysis in a chaotropic solution, followed by two PCR inhibitor removal steps, binding of DNA to a silica membrane, and is finished with wash steps. Guanidine carryover, which impedes PCR, is a common feature of these kinds of methods, so DNA cleanup is often required. A cost-effective magnetic bead clean-up step is recommended for samples with low 260/230 ratios, and a published protocol is provided for the magnetic bead solution. Overall, this protocol can reduce extraction costs to \u003c$2 (CAD) per sample. The protocol can also be adapted to a high-throughput magnetic bead based setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: soil DNA extraction, environmental DNA,magnetic bead gDNA cleanup

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"11ld3","text":"This protocol is written for mineral soil DNA extraction. For fresh mineral soil samples 200-225 mg is optimal for most soil types. For freeze-dried and homogenized mineral soils, 100-150 mg is optimal. For freeze-dried and homogenized forest floor samples, 50 mg is optimal. Optimize the sample mass for your sample type before increasing throughput.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3da1f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffo7i","text":"If Solution 1 has precipitated, heat at   in a dry bath to dissolve. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4knso","text":"Warm Solution 6 in a   dry bath before beginning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bdtip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C6B7F09B87D111EEB2620A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"60","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"drrsj","text":"Add   of fresh mineral soil to a prepared 2mL bead tube and secure lid tightly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c7mqs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"225","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vq6e","text":"Secure bead tube to vortex genie homogenizer and vortex at maximum speed for 20\nminutes. Adjust homogenization step to suit your homogenization setup. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3a623","text":"Centrifuge tubes at 17000 × g for 2 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bcsp6","text":"Transfer the supernatant to a clean 1.5 mL tube. Expect   of supernatant. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2f0dv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400-500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cqo7","text":"Add 250 uL of Solution 2 and vortex for 5 s. Incubate in freezer   for 5 minutes.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8pp3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"90b4g","text":"Centrifuge for 2 minutes at 17000 × g","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qbbh","text":"Avoiding the pellet, transfer up to   of supernatant to a clean 1.5 mL tube\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bfm9l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22is9","text":"Make an equal parts master mix of Solution 3A and 3B, adding   of this mix to each tube. Incubate in freezer    for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b23i1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3CCD6ABF87D111EEB2620A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"49c2t","text":"Centrifuge for 2 minutes at 17000 × g. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8g3f6","text":"Avoiding the pellet, transfer up to  of supernatant to a new 2 mL collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6rpn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"750","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ekgn","text":"Shake to mix solution C4 and add   to the supernatant from step 4.11. Mix with pipette and let stand for 3 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25c9q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j4ot","text":"Load   onto a spin column and centrifuge at 10000 ×g for 1 minute. Discard flow through. To reduce plastic waste, carefully eject pipette tip back into the collection tube for re-use in proceeding steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"270t1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"675","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cur9s","text":"Repeat step 4.13 twice until all the sample has been processed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajp55","text":"Add   of Solution 5. Allow the solution to sit on the silica membrane for 1 minute. Centrifuge for 30 s at 10000 × g and discard the flow through. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2bf3","text":"Add   of  . Allow the solution to sit on the silica membrane for 1 minute. Centrifuge for 30 s at 10000 × g and discard the flow through. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"80","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"Ethanol","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fnip5","text":"Centrifuge again for 1 minute at 10000 × g to dry the column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d80pj","text":"Add  of warm   Solution 6 to the centre of the membrane and wait 5 minutes while the solution absorbs onto the membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ravh","text":"Centrifuge for 30s at 10 000 × g. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"h1g9","text":"Check DNA concentration and repeat steps 4.17-4.18 only if yield is acceptable. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b0jf","text":"Soil DNA from this protocol is often of poor quality (low 260/230 values) due to GuHCl carryover. This is common even in Qiagen’s powersoil kits, which use similar chemistry. Often DNA cleanup is necessary to improve quality. DNA can be cleaned up using commercial bead kits (e.g. ProNex, AMP-pure), or with a non-commercial (DIY) solid-phase reversible immobilization (SPRI) bead solution. This following is a cleanup procedure that has been tested with a DIY SPRI bead solution. This solution can be used in size-selection protocols, but the protocol below is designed to return DNA fragments of all sizes. Expect a 30% reduction in DNA yield. For difficult samples, I have successfully used 2 or even 3 clean ups on the same sample, reducing elution volume to prevent overly diluting samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtgdc","text":"
The recipe for the SPRI bead solution can be found here: https://openwetware.org/wiki/SPRI_bead_mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":42}],"data":{}},{"key":"8tjq1","text":"
The SPRI solution recipe has been tested exactly as listed in the previous link, except Sera-Mag Carboxylate-Modified (E7) magnetic beads (Cytiva cat. no.  24152105050250) were used instead of the more expensive speed beads referenced in the recipe. Although Cytiva does not
recommend its beads for purification of genomic DNA, testing revealed good recovery of high molecular weight DNA fragments from a DNA ladder. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6b1lt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o9m2","text":"Before beginning, the bead solution should be brought to room temperature and should be well mixed prior to use. Also, prepare an   solution, being sure to measure water and ethanol separately before combining. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":130,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A07ED38887D211EEB2620A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://openwetware.org/wiki/SPRI_bead_mix"}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"85","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"ethanol","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cq686","text":"To each sample to be cleaned up, add 2.5x vol of the SPRI bead solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7o7lf","text":"Vortex samples for 15 seconds and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes. If solution is sticking to the sides of the tubes, briefly spin down. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dpeol","text":"Place tubes on magnetic stand for 5 minutes or until the beads have separated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vvoo","text":"Aspirate the cleared solution using a pipette. The beads are easily drawn out with the supernatant, so carefully aspirate, leaving behind 5 uL of supernatant if necessary. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8icr1","text":"Without removing tubes from magnetic stand, add   of   to each tube. Increase the volume of ethanol for larger samples, ensuring that the beads are covered with the ethanol solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9087","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"85","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"ethanol","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ibqb","text":"Vortex for tubes 5 seconds and return tubes to magnetic stand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7itf1","text":"Aspirate ethanol solution once cleared (usually 30 seconds).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qkq0","text":"Wash again with   of 85% ethanol. To speed up drying, aspirate as much ethanol\nas possible with a small volume pipette (without aspirating the beads).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dviur","text":"Allow samples to air dry for 10 minutes. Drying time can be reduced to 3-5 minutes by placing tubes in   dry bath. Do not over dry – the beads should look slightly glossy but should not be cracked. The beads are too wet if when lightly flicking the tube with a finger the beads streak across the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hsfc","text":"Remove tubes from magnetic plate and resuspend in   of Solution 6 (10 mM tris pH 8.5), gently pipetting 10 times to homogenize. The amount of elution buffer can be increased but should not be decreased below  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":208,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d4mid","text":"Incubate samples for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49gn8","text":"Place tubes back on magnetic stand and allow beads to separate (1 minute).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42n7i","text":"Transfer eluate to a new tube, being careful not to draw up beads. In my experience, bead carryover does not interfere with PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
